intro: Arjona ameghinoi, commonly known as the Andean arjona, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and orange. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to the cold, arid conditions of the Andes. Arjona ameghinoi is often found in open areas and along rocky outcrops at elevations above 3,000 meters.
